channel.title: CVE Feed for Mesa Labs -- AmegaView
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Mesa Labs -- AmegaView

item.title: CVE-2021-27445|2024-08-03T20:48:17.222Z -- mesa%20labs -- amegaview
item.description: Mesa Labs AmegaView Versions 3.0 and prior has insecure file permissions that could be exploited to escalate privileges on the device.

item.title: CVE-2021-27449|2024-08-03T20:48:17.158Z -- mesa%20labs -- amegaview
item.description: Mesa Labs AmegaView Versions 3.0 and prior has a command injection vulnerability that can be exploited to execute commands in the web server.

item.title: CVE-2021-27447|2024-08-03T20:48:17.185Z -- mesa%20labs -- amegaview
item.description: Mesa Labs AmegaView version 3.0 is vulnerable to a command injection, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2021-27451|2024-08-03T20:48:17.157Z -- mesa%20labs -- amegaview
item.description: Mesa Labs AmegaView Versions 3.0 and priorâ€™s passcode is generated by an easily reversible algorithm, which may allow an attacker to gain access to the device.

item.title: CVE-2021-27453|2024-08-03T20:48:17.189Z -- mesa%20labs -- amegaview
item.description: Mesa Labs AmegaView Versions 3.0 uses default cookies that could be set to bypass authentication to the web application, which may allow an attacker to gain access.
